intro: Gomphia cardiosperma, commonly known as the heartseed plant, is a unique member of the Restionaceae family, native to South Africa. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its dense, wiry foliage and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces distinctive seed capsules that contain a single, large seed, giving it its common name. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal and inland fynbos regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
